alert.note: Alert for Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued May 28 at 4:02AM MDT until May 28 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...WARM, DRY, AND WINDY CONDITIONS ON THE PLAINS THIS AFTERNOON... .An approaching weather system will produce stronger winds this afternoon. In addition, it will remain dry with low humidities. The strongest winds will be south of Interstate 70 and near the foothills. Recent rain and snow and spring greenup will limit the fire danger across most of northeastern Colorado, but additional caution should be used with fire today. A Red Flag Warning will be in effect for southern Lincoln and southeast Elbert county which have received less moisture and will have some of the stronger winds. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 6 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE ZONE 247...SOUTHERN LINCOLN AND SOUTHEAST ELBERT COUNTIES... The National Weather Service in Denver has issued a Red Flag Warning for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from 11 AM this morning to 6 PM MDT this evening. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * Affected Area...Fire Weather Zone 247. * Timing...11 AM TO 6 PM MDT * Winds...Southwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * Relative Humidity...As low as 9 percent. * Impacts...Any fires that start will be likely to spread rapidly.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County
